Chapter One Even though [the bar]179-the bar was thumping with loud music and [the crowd]180-the crowd was shoulder to shoulder , [no one]181-no one approached [Logan Hawkings]75-logan . [He]75-logan stood alone , an island of calm in a roiling sea of bodies . It might have been the “ fuck off ”[216-the five men] expression on [his]75-logan face , or the crisp cut of [his]75-logan expensive tailored clothing that told [people]182-people [he]75-logan did n’t belong in [this neighborhood]183-this neighborhood . It could have been because [he]75-logan walked with an arrogant swagger that made [men]184-men get out of the way and [women]185-women nudge [[their]185-women girlfriends]186-their girlfriends with interest . None of that mattered . [He]75-logan was n’t [here]187-here to socialize . [He]75-logan moved past [the bar]179-the bar , down [a narrow hall]189-a narrow hall to [a back room]190-a back room . [A man — tall , head shaven]191-a man — tall , head shaven — stood in front of the door there . [The guard]192-the guard wore sunglasses despite being indoors , a suit , and an earpiece with a black cord that wound behind [his]75-logan ear and around the back of [his]75-logan neck . [His]192-the guard posture becoming alert , [the bodyguard]193-the bodyguard watched [Logan]75-logan as [he]75-logan approached . With a practiced ease , [Logan]75-logan swept the second and third fingers of [his]75-logan right hand over [his]75-logan shoulder and then rested them on [his]75-logan biceps in the exact spot where [his]75-logan tattoo lay under [his]75-logan clothing . [The man]194-the man nodded and stepped aside . [Logan]75-logan pushed the door open and strode down the stairs into [the basement]195-the basement . Already there was a thick haze of cigar smoke above the large green octagon table set up in the center of [the room]196-the room . A buffet had been set up off to one side and was being ignored . Beer bottles and poker chips littered the table . Ah , Brotherhood night . [His]75-logan favorite night of the week . [Logan]75-logan gave [the room]196-the room a quick once - over . [Everyone]198-everyone was [here]187-here already ; [he]75-logan was [the last one to arrive]200-the last one to arrive . No surprise there . [The men seated at the table]201-the men seated at the table were roughly the same age . [All]202-all were clean - cut , fit and wore clothes that spoke of money . [They]202-all all carried [themselves]202-all with the confidence that success brought , though in some , the confidence was more swagger than anything . Beside the empty chair held for [him]75-logan sat [Hunter Buchanan]76-hunter , [the scarred , silent real - estate tycoon]203-the scarred , silent real - estate tycoon , and [[Logan]75-logan ’s most trusted friend]204-logan ’s most trusted friend . Next to [him]76-hunter sat [Reese Durham]77-reese , [a young , brash man on the cusp of hitting [his]77-reese billion - dollar fortune]205-a young , brash man on the cusp of hitting his billion - dollar fortune . Beside [him]76-hunter sat [Griffin Verdi]78-griffin , [English aristocracy]206-english aristocracy and [the ‘ professor ’ of [[their]208-their small group]209-their small group]207-the ‘ professor ’ of their small group . Then was [Jonathan Lyons]79-jonathan , [owner of [Lyon Automotives and [notorious adventurer]212-notorious adventurer and [thrill seeker]213-thrill seeker]211-lyon automotives and notorious adventurer and thrill seeker]210-owner of lyon automotives and notorious adventurer and thrill seeker . At [his]79-jonathan side was [Cade Archer]80-cade , [the philanthropist of [[their]208-their group]215-their group]214-the philanthropist of their group . [The five men]216-the five men barely glanced up from [their]216-the five men cards as [he]79-jonathan entered . “ [You]79-jonathan ’re late , ”[80-cade] [Reese Durham]77-reese told [him]79-jonathan , a cigar hanging from [his]77-reese mouth . [He]77-reese examined [his]77-reese cards , face impassive . [Logan]75-logan slipped [his]75-logan jacket off and tossed it into a corner , then moved to the only empty seat at the table . [Cade]80-cade raised a hand in greeting . [Logan]75-logan grasped it and then turned to clap [Hunter Buchanan]76-hunter on the back . [The man]194-the man ’s scars looked hideous in the dim light of [the room]196-the room . “ About time [you]79-jonathan got [here]187-here , ”[80-cade] [Cade]80-cade said in a pleasant voice . “ [Reese]77-reese was just asking about [Gloria]81-gloria . ”[75-logan] [Logan]75-logan frowned , shaking [his]75-logan head as [he]75-logan sat down between [the two men]219-the two men . “ [Gloria]81-gloria who ? ”[75-logan] [Reese]77-reese grinned at [him]75-logan across the table . “ [You]79-jonathan know . Stacked [Gloria]81-gloria with the big blond hair . [I]75-logan guess [you]79-jonathan ’re not seeing [her]81-gloria anymore ? [You]79-jonathan brought [her]81-gloria to the Stewart fund - raiser a few months ago . ”[75-logan] Had [he]75-logan ? [Logan]75-logan could n’t recall . [He]75-logan had n’t had a second date with [anyone]220-anyone since . . . well , since [Danica]82-danica . Had n’t been interested enough and had n’t made the time . “ [I]75-logan do n’t recall a [Gloria]81-gloria . ”[75-logan] “ So [you]79-jonathan would n’t care if [I]75-logan dated [her]81-gloria ? [I]75-logan met [her]81-gloria at a party the other night and would n’t mind seeing [her]81-gloria again . ”[75-logan] “ Care ? ”[75-logan] [Logan]75-logan snorted . “ [I]77-reese ca n’t even recall [her]81-gloria face . [She]81-gloria ’s all [yours]79-jonathan . ”[77-reese] “ Did [you]75-logan know [she]81-gloria ’s [a friend of [Danica]82-danica ’s]2077-a friend of danica ’s ? ”[75-logan] [Reese]77-reese asked . “ Then [you]79-jonathan ’re more than welcome to [her]81-gloria , ”[75-logan] [Logan]75-logan said , [his]75-logan voice cool . “ If [she]81-gloria ’s [a friend of [Danica]82-danica ’s]2077-a friend of danica ’s , [she]81-gloria can burn in hell for all [I]77-reese care . ”[77-reese] “ Thought [you]75-logan ’d say that , ”[75-logan] [Reese]77-reese said cheerfully . “ Just do [me]76-hunter a favor and do n’t bring up [Danica]82-danica again , ”[76-hunter] [Logan]75-logan said , [his]75-logan tone friendly but with a touch of warning . The last thing [he]75-logan wanted to do was discuss [a money - grubbing gold digger]221-a money - grubbing gold digger . [She]221-a money - grubbing gold digger was in [his]75-logan past , and [he]75-logan had no intention of dwelling on [her]221-a money - grubbing gold digger . [[His]75-logan father]222-his father had mocked [him]75-logan for falling for [Danica]82-danica . [He]222-his father ’d said that [Logan]75-logan was being [a stupid fool]223-a stupid fool . And that grated more than anything . “ So what took [you]75-logan so long ? ”[75-logan] [Hunter]76-hunter pulled out a stack of chips , glancing over at [Logan]75-logan . A smooth , effortless change of subject . [Logan]75-logan turned to [Hunter]76-hunter and gave [the scarred man]225-the scarred man a check for [his]225-the scarred man share that evening . [Hunter]76-hunter added it to the bank and shoved the pile of chips in [his]76-hunter direction . “ [I]75-logan have [a new driver]2079-a new driver , ”[75-logan] [Logan]75-logan said . “ [He]2079-a new driver got lost . ”[77-reese] [His]75-logan tone implied that it would n’t happen again . [Reese]77-reese snorted and shook [his]77-reese head . “ Excuses , [excuses]2080-excuses . ”[77-reese] [He]77-reese gestured at the pile of chips in the center of the table . “ [Everyone]198-everyone in ? ”[79-jonathan] [The six men]226-the six men consulted cards as [they]226-the six men were dealt . As cards were laid face up , [Cade]80-cade immediately tossed a bid into the pile . [Four of [the men]228-the men]227-four of the men folded . “ The paladin there ’s got three of a kind showing , ”[79-jonathan] [Jonathan]79-jonathan said with a disgusted glance at [Cade]80-cade . “ [You]80-cade know [he]2079-a new driver ca n’t lie to save [his]2079-a new driver ass . ”[80-cade] [Reese]77-reese sighed and put [his]77-reese cards down as well , the last in besides [Cade]80-cade . “ Hell , [you]80-cade ’re right . [I]80-cade fold , too . ”[80-cade] [Cade]80-cade grinned and raked the money toward [him]80-cade . “ [I]79-jonathan might have been bluffing . ”[79-jonathan] “ [You]80-cade were n’t , ”[75-logan] [Jonathan]79-jonathan said , and took another swig of [his]79-jonathan beer , then leaned back to the catering table and snagged one for [Logan]75-logan . “ [You]80-cade do n’t know how . ”[75-logan] “ All right , ”[75-logan] [Logan]75-logan said , taking the bottle and twisting off the cap . [He]75-logan took a quick drink . “ Now that [we]228-the men ’re all here . . . This month ’s meeting of [the brotherhood]2082-the brotherhood is called to order . ”[228-the men] [The men]228-the men raised [their]228-the men drinks , clinking bottles together . “ Fratres in prosperitatem , ”[228-the men] [they]228-the men all said in unison , as [they]228-the men did every month . [Jonathan]79-jonathan was undeterred . [It]2086-it accumulates on its own . ”[77-reese] “ Says [a man that grew up with wealth]2087-a man that grew up with wealth , ”[77-reese] [Reese]77-reese pointed out . “ Not all of [us]228-the men were so lucky . ”[78-griffin] “ It ’s not [my]78-griffin fault [I]78-griffin was born rich . [Reese]77-reese , [Logan]75-logan , and [Griffin]78-griffin all took [their]231-they turns , sharing any news of the week , and then the conversation moved on . [He]75-logan ended up losing two grand to [Jonathan]79-jonathan without even realizing it . [Reese]77-reese thought [he]75-logan should take a “ vacation . ”[75-logan] [He]75-logan wanted to laugh at the thought . [Successful men]250-successful men did n’t get vacations . [They]250-successful men just got more opportunities . Still , it sounded like an interesting investment , and [he]75-logan liked to keep [Hawkings Conglomerate]22-hawkings conglomerate diverse . [An island resort]251-an island resort was definitely diverse . [He]75-logan noticed [Hunter]76-hunter watching [him]75-logan out of the corner of [his]76-hunter eye . [The elevator car]350-the elevator car was plunged into darkness , and [Brontë]85-brontë lost [her]85-brontë breath , terror gripping [her]85-brontë . “ Great , ”[334-the manager] [the manager]334-the manager said behind [her]85-brontë . “ Just fucking great . ”[358-the man behind her] A hysterical giggle rose in [Brontë]85-brontë ’s throat . Nope . That was the perfect way to cap off [the world]274-the world ’s most horrible vacation .

Chapter Three What a lucky streak [he]450-he ’d been on the past two years . First [Danica]82-danica ’s betrayal , then [[his]450-he father]222-his father ’s death , now this . The icing on the biggest fucking cake of [his]450-he life . [[His]450-he father]222-his father would ’ve said [he]222-his father ’d brought it upon [himself]222-his father . But then again , [[his]450-he father]222-his father had always been [a huge bastard]454-a huge bastard . [He]222-his father ’d disapproved of everything that [Logan]75-logan had ever touched . Not a stretch to think that [he]222-his father ’d have disapproved of [Logan]75-logan ’s latest acquisition . It had seemed like a simple task . Chapter Ten [Brontë]85-brontë dashed down [the street]1127-the street , ignoring [the people around [her]85-brontë]1451-the people around her . Chapter Fourteen When [Brontë]85-brontë woke up the next morning , [her]85-brontë head was pounding and [her]85-brontë mouth felt like a dirty , old sock . Epilogue It did n’t take long for [Brontë]85-brontë to decide what [she]85-brontë wanted to do with [her]85-brontë life . [Gretchen]129-gretchen ’s book donation charity had inspired [her]85-brontë , and after signing up for continuing education classes at [NYU]71-nyu , [she]85-brontë worked with [[Logan]75-logan ’s financial advisors]1943-logan ’s financial advisors to set up [a charity]3156-a charity . [Philosophy Reads]98-philosophy was soon born , complete with a fancy website and nonprofit status . [Her]85-brontë goal ? To bring [her]85-brontë love of reading and knowledge to those who could n’t afford it or could n’t get out . [Brontë]85-brontë selected two books — one classic and one modern — and then purchased hundreds of copies . These [she]85-brontë had delivered to [local libraries]1945-local libraries , [retirement homes]3153-retirement homes , and [hospitals]1947-hospitals , and [she]85-brontë set up weekly meetings for [people]182-people to meet and discuss [them]182-people . [She]85-brontë nearly danced with delight when [her]85-brontë first meeting — at [the retirement home where [Gretchen]129-gretchen had dropped off books before]1949-the retirement home where gretchen had dropped off books before — had an attendance of [nearly fifty people]1950-nearly fifty people , all of [them]1950-nearly fifty people brimming with enthusiasm to discuss that month ’s reads , The Iliad and [Harry Potter]159-harry potter and the Sorcerer ’s Stone . [She]85-brontë wanted to eventually introduce [them]1950-nearly fifty people to heavier reads , but [she]85-brontë ’d start [them]1950-nearly fifty people out slow . [Jessica Clare]73-jessica clare also writes as [Jill Myles]164-jill myles and [Jessica Sims]165-jessica sims . As [Jessica Clare]73-jessica clare [she]73-jessica clare writes sexy contemporary romance .
